subject: Gymnastics
lead_paragraph: The world gymnastics champion Shawn Johnson expected to be back in her gym in West Des Moines, Iowa, two days after rising floodwaters left a foot of water in the building. About 100 volunteers spent 17 hours at Chow’s Gymnastics and Dance Institute on Saturday, cleaning out the gym and building a new gymnastics floor. Johnson trained Friday and Saturday at Iowa State, about 30 miles away. Johnson leaves Monday for the Olympic trials, which begin Thursday in Philadelphia.
